New Records: Adolis Garcia became the first player in postseason history with a Golden Sombrero (four strikeouts) and a grand slam.
Garcia was the first player in LCS history to strikeout four times and hit a grand slam.
Garcia was the first player in a nine-inning postseason game to hit a homer after being donned with the Golden Sombrero.
Key Match Events: Adolis Garcia hit a grand slam in the top of the ninth with the bases loaded, one out, and his team holding a 5–2 lead.
The Rangers staved off elimination for one more day, forcing a Game Seven in this ALCS that has yet to see a home victory.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Catcher Jonah Heim said, “That’s baseball justice,” he said. “They’re booing him all game, and he puts the game on ice. I don’t know how you can boo someone for getting hit, but it is what it is, and he quieted them pretty quickly there.”
Outfielder Travis Jankowski added, “The environment he played in tonight wasn’t the easiest one, but it’s one of those things. In any big situation, I’m picking him.”

Third baseman Josh Jung was stunned to hear Garcia was the first to do it, saying, “Wow. That’s awesome.” But he also said, “It’s not fun getting booed all game. Then to silence the crowd in the ninth gives him confidence going into tomorrow, because it’s gonna be the same thing.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be at 8:07 pm Eastern, 7:07 Central Monday night.
Max Scherzer will toe the rubber for the Rangers against Cristian Javier of the Astros.
Others: The Rangers and Astros will play in Game Seven, with the Rangers taking a 9-2 win in Game Six.
